Comment.Review: You know a book is good if it stays with you a few days after reading it.  The author, without being at all obvious about it, leads us through a story that has many levels and explorations of what it means to be "captive".  Captive to a slave owner, captive to a concept, captive in an exhibit.  It looks at what it takes to be truly free.This is my first book by Edugyan.  It won't be my last.
Comment.Title: Impressive

Comment.Review: Interesting that this novel ends in Africa, albeit the northern portion of the continent. Dahomey out of reach, beyond the veil. Still so far from Home. I look forward to reading Esi Edugyan's other offerings.
Comment.Title: Riveting
